title: Opposition hits out at Arvind Kejriwal over women’s safety issue
text:
Comments 
New Delhi, Oct 19: Opposition BJP today accused accused Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal of “politicising” women’s safety issue while Congress demanded his “resignation” for “failing” to prevent sexual assault on children in the national capital.Leader of Opposition in Delhi Assembly BJP’s Vijender Gupta accused Kejriwal of “politicising” issues of women’s safety and protection of children from sexual offences.”There is no point in asking for reduction of child offenders’ age from 18 to 15 years. There is also no point in asking for death sentence for rapists of non-adult offenders. The demand for fast track for rape victims is also politically motivated,” he said. (Also Read: Najeeb Jung, Arvind Kejriwal not on same page as new name comes up in Lokayukta search) 
All these issues now being raised have been discussed and deeply deliberated by experts, jurists, the Supreme Court, Standing Committee of Parliament and finally the Parliament itself, he said.”No Chief Minister except Kejriwal invokes the Prime Minister in local issues every day,” Gupta said, advising Kejriwal not to interfere in issues which do not lie within his jurisdiction.The Delhi Pradesh Congress Committee “strongly” condemned the increasing number of sexual assaults and atrocities on minor children in Delhi and “inaction” of Kejriwal in preventing such crimes. 
Demanding Kejriwal’s resignation for his “failure” to prevent heinous crimes against small children, DPCC spokesperson Sharmishtha Mukherjee said that he was “only interested in taking personal mileage out of such incidents”.”When the ‘Nirbhaya’ case happened in Delhi, Kejriwal attacked the Sheila Dikshit government, and now DPCC demands Kejriwal’s resignation if he cannot prevent sexual assaults on women and minor children,” she said.
